N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4800.1 - Purpose and scope

State Regulations
(a) The
people's right to know the process of government decision-making and the
documents and statistics leading to determinations is basic to our society. Access to such information should not be thwarted by shrouding it with the
cloak of secrecy or confidentiality. (b) The regulations contained in this Part
provide information concerning the procedures by which records may be
obtained. (c) Personnel shall
furnish to the public the information and records required by the Freedom of

Information Law, as well as records otherwise available by law. (d) Any conflicts among laws governing public
access to records shall be construed in favor of the widest possible
availability of public records. Notes
